p: The composition of the essential oils of S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia, S. blancoana subsp. mariolensis and their hybrid S x hegelmaieri is very similar, and mostly in accordance with the chromatographic profile prescribed in the current standards of the European Pharmacopeia, ISO and AENOR for the “Spanish sage oil.” Therefore, S. blancoana subsp. mariolensis and its hybrid should be considered as suitable sources of the oil together with the accepted S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia. There is no safety concern related to the content of thujone for the consumption of the traditional liquors homemade from these species, since this compound is only found in trace amounts in their essential oils.
